thread.title: Sexual assault reported in Boston University dorm - News
thread.title_full: Sexual assault reported in Boston University dorm - News

author: boston.com
title: Sexual assault reported in Boston University dorm - News
text:
Early Sunday morning, a female Boston University student reported that an unknown, college-aged man entered her dorm room and sexually assaulted her, according to an alert sent out to BU students later that day.
The student described the assailant as a white male around 5’8” to 5’10” with brown hair and a medium build. She told BU police he was wearing a dark-colored long-sleeved button down shirt and a down vest.
Related Links BU releases report detailing sexual assault on campus Largest campus assault survey shows more than one in five women are sexually assaulted The man fled the dorm, known as StuVi 2, after the alleged assault.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below BU police didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment from Boston.com about whether a suspect has been identified, but Sergeant Larry Cuzzi told The Daily Free Press Sunday that the incident was under investigation.
Last spring, BU conducted a survey about sexual assaults on campus and published the findings this fall. The survey found that nearly one in four women —23 percent—were sexually assaulted during their time on campus.
